Definition: Metabolic disease causing high blood glucose and possible neuropathy/poor circulation.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Gentle Swedish; light-to-moderate pressure; focus on circulation; check feet/limbs for sensation; shorter sessions if needed.
Massage Contraindication: Avoid areas with reduced sensation, ulcers, or infections; avoid aggressive deep tissue on extremities; monitor for hypoglycemia.

Definition: Blood pressure persistently above normal (≥140/90 without treatment).
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Relaxation focus: effleurage, petrissage; slow pacing; neck/shoulders/back; breath cueing.
Massage Contraindication: Uncontrolled hypertension: defer massage; avoid vigorous/deep work, heat hydrotherapy; avoid head-down positions.

Definition: Blood pressure lower than normal with possible dizziness or fainting.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Brisk effleurage, light tapotement; gradual position changes; end seated; hydrate.
Massage Contraindication: Avoid sudden postural changes and overly sedating techniques; monitor dizziness.

Definition: Headache from muscle tension in scalp/neck; bilateral, band-like pressure.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Scalp massage; trigger points upper traps/SCM/suboccipitals; gentle neck stretches; jaw relaxation.
Massage Contraindication: Avoid heavy pressure on cranium; red flags (sudden severe headache, neuro signs) require medical referral.

Definition: Recurrent pulsating headache often with nausea and light sensitivity; may have aura.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Quiet room; gentle head/neck/shoulders; diaphragmatic breathing; post-episode maintenance for neck/trigger points.
Massage Contraindication: Active severe migraine with neurologic deficits—refer; avoid strong smells and bright light; avoid deep pressure.

Definition: Normal gestation without high-risk factors.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Side-lying positioning; gentle Swedish; edema strokes toward heart; support pillows; focus low back/hips/feet (light).
Massage Contraindication: High-risk pregnancy, preeclampsia, severe swelling with headache/visual changes; avoid deep abdominal work; avoid prone post 1st trimester.

Definition: 6–12 weeks after delivery with changing posture and stress.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Low back/neck/shoulders; gentle abdominal work if medically cleared; lymphatic light strokes for edema.
Massage Contraindication: Cesarean/incision not healed; infection, fever, DVT signs; avoid prone if uncomfortable.

Definition: Degenerative joint disease with cartilage wear causing pain/stiffness.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Warm-up effleurage; gentle joint mobilizations within comfort; surrounding muscle petrissage; heat only if cleared.
Massage Contraindication: Acute inflamed joints—avoid deep work and stretching; avoid end-range pain.

Definition: Autoimmune inflammatory polyarthritis causing joint swelling and pain.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: During remission: gentle Swedish, ROM within tolerance; lymphatic/light strokes during flare.
Massage Contraindication: Active flare—avoid deep pressure/heat; avoid inflamed joints; severe fatigue days defer.

Definition: Chronic widespread pain with tender points, sleep disturbance, fatigue.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Very gentle pressure; slow rhythm; myofascial unwinding; short sessions; emphasize relaxation.
Massage Contraindication: Avoid aggressive/deep work which can trigger flares; monitor post-session soreness.

Definition: Persistent, unexplained fatigue with post-exertional malaise and other symptoms.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Short, gentle sessions; soothing effleurage; lymphatic-style strokes; prioritize rest.
Massage Contraindication: Avoid overstimulation; stop if dizziness or malaise; avoid long sessions.

Definition: Pain along sciatic nerve from lumbar or piriformis irritation.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Gluteal/piriformis release; hamstring work; lumbar paraspinals; nerve glide-friendly positions; heat if tolerated.
Massage Contraindication: Progressive neuro deficits, severe unremitting pain—refer; avoid direct pressure on nerve.

Definition: Lumbar pain without specific serious pathology.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Myofascial release; QL/glute/hip flexor work; gentle mobilizations; breathing and core cueing.
Massage Contraindication: Red flags (trauma, fever, cancer history, cauda equina symptoms) require referral.

Definition: Nucleus pulposus protrusion causing nerve root irritation.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Gentle paraspinal work; avoid end-range flexion; side-lying; traction-inspired decompression positioning.
Massage Contraindication: Worsening neuro signs, bowel/bladder changes—urgent referral; avoid heavy pressure near spine.

Definition: Lateral curvature of the spine with rotation.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Myofascial lengthening on concave side; strengthen cues for convex; breathing into ribcage; gentle mobilizations.
Massage Contraindication: Severe pain, recent surgery without clearance; avoid forceful spinal manipulation.

Definition: Exaggerated thoracic kyphosis or lumbar lordosis due to posture.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Pectoral release, thoracic paraspinals, hip flexors/hamstrings balance; posture education.
Massage Contraindication: Acute pain or structural instability—work gently; avoid aggressive end-range.

Definition: Soft-tissue injury to neck after acceleration-deceleration, subacute phase.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Very gentle effleurage; suboccipital release; pain-free ROM; avoid prone pressure early.
Massage Contraindication: Acute trauma without medical clearance; neurological deficits; vertebral artery symptoms.

Definition: Temporomandibular joint dysfunction causing jaw pain and tightness.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Masseter/temporalis release; intraoral if trained/consented; neck/upper back work; heat compress.
Massage Contraindication: Active infection, dental abscess; avoid excessive intraoral pressure; gloves and consent required.

Definition: Median nerve compression at wrist with numbness/tingling in hand.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Forearm flexor/extensor release; gentle wrist mobilizations; nerve-friendly glides.
Massage Contraindication: Severe weakness or loss of function—refer; avoid compressing carpal tunnel directly.

Definition: Inflammation/irritation of a tendon from overuse.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Cross-fiber friction (moderate); gentle lengthening; ice post-session if advised; gradual load advice.
Massage Contraindication: Acute hot inflammation—use very light or defer; avoid overly painful friction.

Definition: Heel and sole pain from plantar fascia irritation.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Foot arch release; calf/soleus work; gentle stretches; ice bottle roll post care.
Massage Contraindication: Acute tear suspicion—refer; avoid heavy direct pressure on inflamed origin.

Definition: Injury to shoulder rotator cuff muscles/tendons.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Infraspinatus/subscapularis release; scapular mobilizations; pain-free ROM; posterior capsule work.
Massage Contraindication: Acute tear or severe pain—refer; avoid forced abduction or aggressive stretching.

Definition: Overuse of wrist extensors causing lateral elbow pain.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Cross-fiber friction to extensor tendons; forearm release; eccentric loading education.
Massage Contraindication: Acute inflammation—light only; avoid direct compression on nerve.

Definition: Overuse of wrist flexors causing medial elbow pain.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Cross-fiber friction; flexor/pronator release; gradual loading advice.
Massage Contraindication: Acute hot inflammation—gentle only; avoid ulnar nerve compression.

Definition: Inflammation of tendons on thumb side of wrist.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Gentle friction and myofascial on APL/EPB; forearm release; splint-compatible care.
Massage Contraindication: Acute severe pain—limit to light strokes; avoid forceful stretching.

Definition: Tear of muscle fibers causing pain and weakness.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Acute: lymphatic strokes; Subacute: gentle petrissage and pain-free stretching; remodeling: cross-fiber and strengthening cues.
Massage Contraindication: Avoid deep work in acute phase; bruising/hematoma—light only; suspect rupture—refer.

Definition: Stretch/tear of ligament supporting a joint.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Around but not on the ligament; edema management; later, cross-fiber to scar; proprioception cues.
Massage Contraindication: Acute unstable sprain—defer; avoid deep pressure on ligament; refer if severe swelling.

Definition: Dilated, tortuous superficial veins usually in legs.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Light strokes toward heart around veins; elevate legs; avoid direct pressure.
Massage Contraindication: Do not massage directly over veins; screen for DVT signs (pain, heat, swelling)—refer if present.

Definition: Blood clot in deep vein, risk of embolism.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: If suspected or active: NO massage; history with clearance: gentle distal/contralateral work only.
Massage Contraindication: Absolute: suspected or confirmed DVT—urgent medical care; avoid leg massage until cleared.

Definition: Protein-rich fluid accumulation due to lymphatic obstruction.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Manual lymph drainage (MLD) by trained therapist; proximal-to-distal clearing sequences; compression follow-up.
Massage Contraindication: Acute infection (cellulitis), uncontrolled heart failure, active cancer without guidance—defer.

Definition: Swelling from fluid accumulation of various causes.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Very light lymphatic strokes toward nodes; elevate; short sessions.
Massage Contraindication: Heart/kidney failure, DVT, infection—medical clearance needed.

Definition: Coronary or structural heart disease under medical management.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Gentle, calming full-body; avoid overloading; semi-reclined; monitor comfort.
Massage Contraindication: Unstable angina, recent MI without clearance; avoid heavy chest/upper back pressure.

Definition: Chronic airway inflammation with episodic bronchoconstriction.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Thoracic mobility; ribcage/diaphragm release; calm pacing; keep inhaler nearby.
Massage Contraindication: Acute attack—stop and assist; avoid prone face-down if breathing is difficult.

Definition: Chronic airflow limitation (emphysema/chronic bronchitis).
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Gentle back/shoulders; posture work; avoid breath restriction; short sessions.
Massage Contraindication: Severe dyspnea or oxygen desaturation—stop; avoid heavy chest pressure.

Definition: Acute viral infection of upper airways.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Defer until afebrile and recovering; when recovering, gentle drainage strokes and relaxation.
Massage Contraindication: Fever, contagious period—do not massage.

Definition: Infection by SARS-CoV-2; post-acute recovery phase.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Short, gentle sessions; breathing mechanics; gradual return; monitor fatigue.
Massage Contraindication: Acute infection or long-COVID with red flags (clots, chest pain)—medical guidance first.

Definition: Bacterial skin infection with redness, warmth, tenderness.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: No massage over infected area; refer for medical care.
Massage Contraindication: Absolute over affected area; systemic symptoms—defer entirely.

Definition: Inflammatory, itchy skin rash with variable triggers.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Use hypoallergenic oil; gentle strokes; avoid irritants; short nails/gloves if needed.
Massage Contraindication: Avoid broken skin and active flare areas; avoid fragrances.

Definition: Chronic autoimmune skin condition with plaques.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Gentle lotion-based work; avoid picking/irritation; treat surrounding muscles.
Massage Contraindication: Avoid broken plaques; consider sensitivity to oils/lotions.

Definition: Tissue damage with impaired skin barrier.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: No massage over wound; gentle work around area to manage tension; scar mobilization only when healed and cleared.
Massage Contraindication: Open areas, infection, recent grafts—defer.

Definition: Period following surgical procedure.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Only with medical clearance; gentle lymphatic strokes; later, scar mobilization; positioning for comfort.
Massage Contraindication: No work over incision until healed; DVT risk; infection/fever—defer.

Definition: Broken bone during immobilization/healing phase.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Indirect work proximal/distal; edema management; later, gentle ROM and scar work.
Massage Contraindication: No pressure over fracture; suspect non-union or severe pain—refer.

Definition: Blood leakage into tissues after trauma.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Gentle lymphatic strokes; avoid direct pressure; support surrounding areas.
Massage Contraindication: No deep pressure on bruise; monitor for anticoagulant use.

Definition: Low bone density increasing fracture risk.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Gentle pressure; supportive positioning; focus on posture muscles; avoid high-velocity maneuvers.
Massage Contraindication: Avoid aggressive compression or end-range spinal movements.

Definition: Inflammatory arthritis primarily affecting spine and SI joints.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Gentle myofascial; posture and breathing work; maintain mobility without force.
Massage Contraindication: Acute inflammatory flare—light only; avoid forceful spinal movements.

Definition: Autoimmune demyelinating disease with varied neurologic symptoms.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Gentle, cooling if heat-sensitive; short sessions; focus spasticity relief.
Massage Contraindication: Acute relapse—defer; avoid overheating and fatigue.

Definition: Neurodegenerative disorder with rigidity and tremor.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Rhythmic rocking; slow petrissage; joint mobilizations; cue breathing; adapt positioning.
Massage Contraindication: Orthostatic hypotension risk; avoid sudden changes; monitor fatigue.

Definition: Past cerebrovascular event with residual deficits.
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Gentle, slow work; lymphatic for edema; facilitate ROM; position to protect weak side.
Massage Contraindication: Acute stroke symptoms—medical emergency; be cautious with anticoagulants.

Definition: Conditions with impaired clotting (e.g., hemophilia).
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Very gentle pressure; avoid deep tissue; compressive holds rather than kneading.
Massage Contraindication: Avoid aggressive techniques; any unusual bruising—stop and refer.

Definition: Use of blood thinners (e.g., warfarin, DOACs).
Best Massage Technique / Steps: Light-to-moderate pressure; avoid deep tissue and strong friction; monitor bruising.
Massage Contraindication: Avoid percussive tools and strong pressure; caution with stretching.
